verses.text: Then she came and worshiped Him, saying, “Lord help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said, “It is not meet to take children’s bread and cast it to dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “Truth, Lord; yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered and said unto her, “O woman, great is thy faith. Be it unto thee even as thou wilt.” And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus departed from thence and came nigh unto the Sea of Galilee, and went up onto a mountain and sat down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great multitudes came unto Him, having with them those who were lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus’ feet, and He healed them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: insomuch that the multitude wondered when they saw the dumb to speak, and the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see. And they glorified the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus called His disciples unto Him and said, “I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with Me now three days and have had nothing to eat; and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint on the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His disciples said unto Him, “From whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness as to fill so great a multitude?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, “How many loaves have ye?” And they said, “Seven, and a few little fishes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and broke them and gave to His disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all ate and were filled. And they took up of the broken pieces that were left, seven baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He sent away the multitude, and took the boat and went into the coasts of Magdala.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and testing, desired Him that He would show them a sign from Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said unto them, “When it is evening ye say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and lowering.’ O ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky, but can ye not discern the signs of the times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign, and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of the prophet Jonah.” And He left them and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when His disciples had come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, “Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “It is because we have taken no bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus perceived this, He said unto them, “O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, ‘because ye have brought no bread’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do ye not yet understand, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How is it that ye do not understand that I spoke it not to you concerning bread, but that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the Sadducees?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then understood they that He bade them not to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, saying, “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Some say that Thou art John the Baptist, some Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon Peter answered and said, “Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said unto him, “Blessed art thou, Simon Bar-Jonah, for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee, but My Father who is in Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say also unto thee, that thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build My church; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give unto thee the keys of the Kingdom of Heaven. And whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in Heaven, and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in Heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He charged His disciples that they should tell no man that He was Jesus the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time forth began Jesus to show unto His disciples that He must go unto Jerusalem and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised again the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter took Him and began to rebuke Him, saying, “Be it far from Thee, Lord; this shall not happen unto Thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He turned and said unto Peter, “Get thee behind Me, Satan! Thou art an offense unto Me; for thou savorest not the things that be of God, but those that be of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto His disciples, “If any man will come after Me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it, and whosoever will lose his life for My sake shall find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world and lose his own soul? Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man shall come in the glory of His Father with His angels, and then He shall reward every man according to his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, there are some standing here who shall not taste of death till they see the Son of Man coming in His Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John his brother, and brought them up onto a high mountain apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He was transfigured before them; and His face shone as the sun, and His raiment was white as the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elijah, talking with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Peter and said unto Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If Thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles: one for Thee and one for Moses and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he yet spoke, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them. And behold, a voice out of the cloud, said, “This Is My Beloved Son In Whom I Am Well Pleased. Hear Ye Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces and were sore afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus came and touched them and said, “Arise, and be not afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, “Tell the vision to no man until the Son of Man be risen again from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His disciples asked Him, saying, “Why then say the scribes that Elijah must first come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, “Elijah truly shall first come and restore all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you that Elijah is come already, and they knew him not, but have done unto him whatsoever they pleased. Likewise shall also the Son of Man suffer by them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples understood that He spoke unto them of John the Baptist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come to the multitude, there came to Him a certain man, kneeling down to Him and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is lunatic and sorely vexed; for ofttimes he falleth into the fire and oft into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I brought him to Thy disciples, and they could not cure him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered and said, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I suffer you? Bring him hither to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked the devil, and he departed out of him, and the child was cured from that very hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart and said, “Why could we not cast him out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, “Because of your unbelief; for verily I say unto you, if ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, ‘Remove hence to yonder place,’ and it shall remove. And nothing shall be impossible unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, “The Son of Man shall be betrayed into the hands of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall kill Him, and the third day He shall be raised again.” And they were exceeding sorry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come to Capernaum, those who collected the tribute money came to Peter and said, “Doth not your master pay tribute?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Yes.” And when he had come into the house, Jesus preceded him, saying, “What thinkest thou, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? From their own children, or from strangers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said unto Him, “From strangers.” Jesus said unto him, “Then are the children free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea and cast a hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up. And when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money. That take, and give unto them for Me and thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, “Who is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus called a little child unto Him, and set him in the midst of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Verily I say unto you, unless ye be converted and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoso shall receive one such little child in My name, receiveth Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoso shall cause one of these little ones who believe in Me to fall, it were better for him that a millstone were hung about his neck, and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe unto the world because of offenses! For it must happen that offenses come, but woe to that man by whom the offense cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if thy hand or thy foot cause thee to fall, cut them off and cast them from thee; it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet, to be cast into everlasting fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if thine eye cause thee to fall, pluck it out and cast it from thee; it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones; for I say unto you that in Heaven their angels do always behold the face of My Father who is in Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Son of Man is come to save that which was lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How think ye? If a man have a hundred sheep and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and goeth into the mountains and seeketh that which is gone astray?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth more over that sheep than over the ninety and nine which went not astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in Heaven that one of these little ones should perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover, if thy brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone. If he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he will not hear thee, then take with thee one or two more, that ‘in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he shall neglect to hear them, tell it unto the church; but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as a heathen man and a publican.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in Heaven; and so whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again I say unto you, that if two of you shall agree on earth concerning anything that they shall ask, it shall be done for them by My Father who is in Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where two or three are gathered together in My name, there am I in the midst of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came to Him and said, “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, “I say not unto thee, until seven times, but until seventy times seven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore is the Kingdom of Heaven likened unto a certain king who would settle accounts with his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him who owed him ten thousand talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But inasmuch as he could not pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife and children and all that he had, and payment to be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant therefore fell down and did homage to him, saying,‘Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion, and loosed him and forgave him the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the same servant went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred pence. And he laid hands on him, and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what thou owest.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his fellow servant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he would not, but went and cast him into prison till he should pay the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when his fellow servants saw what was done, they were very sorry and came and told unto their lord all that was done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his lord, after he had called him, said unto him, ‘O thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou desiredst me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellow servant, even as I had pity on thee?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors till he should pay all that was due unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise shall My heavenly Father do also unto you, if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother’s trespasses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had finished these sayings, He departed from Galilee and came into the region of Judea beyond the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees also came unto Him, testing Him and saying unto Him, “Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered and said unto them, “Have ye not read, that He that made them at the beginning made them male and female,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘For this cause shall a man leave father and mother and shall cleave to his wife, and the two shall be one flesh’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they are no more two, but one flesh. What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said unto Him, “Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement and to put her away?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto them, “Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, suffered you to put away your wives, but from the beginning it was not so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say unto you, whosoever shall put away his wife, except it be for fornication, and shall marry another, committeth adultery; and whoso marrieth her who is put away doth commit adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said unto Him, “If the case of the man be so with his wife, it is not good to marry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said unto them, “All men cannot receive this saying, save they to whom it is given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are some eunuchs who were so born from their mother’s womb, and there are some eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men, and there are eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs for the Kingdom of Heaven’s sake. He that is able to receive it, let him receive it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then were there brought unto Him little children, that He should put His hands on them and pray. And the disciples rebuked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Jesus said, “Suffer little children, and forbid them not to come unto Me,for of such is the Kingdom of Heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He laid His hands on them and departed thence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, one came and said unto Him, “Good Master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said unto him, “Why callest thou Me good? There is none good but One, that is, God. But if thou wilt enter into Life, keep the commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto Him, “Which?” Jesus said, “‘Thou shalt do no murder; thou shalt not commit adultery; thou shalt not steal; thou shalt not bear false witness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: honor thy father and thy mother; and, thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man said unto Him, “All these things have I kept from my youth up. What lack I yet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “If thou wilt be perfect, go and sell what thou hast and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in Heaven; and come and follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful, for he had great possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto His disciples, “Verily I say unto you, that a rich man shall hardly enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again I say unto you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When His disciples heard it, they were exceedingly amazed, saying, “Who then can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus beheld them and said unto them, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered and said unto Him, “Behold, we have forsaken all and followed Thee. What shall we have therefore?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, “Verily I say unto you, that ye that have followed Me, in the regeneration when the Son of Man shall sit on the throne of His glory, ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone that hath forsaken houses or brethren or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands, for My name’s sake, shall receive a hundredfold and shall inherit everlasting life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many that are first shall be last, and the last shall be first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Kingdom of Heaven is like unto a man that is a householder, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers into his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had agreed with the laborers for a penny a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out about the third hour and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto them, ‘Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right I will give you.’ And they went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour and did likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing idle, and said unto them, ‘Why stand ye here all the day idle?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said unto him, ‘Because no man hath hired us.’ He said unto them, ‘Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right, that shall ye receive.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when evening had come, the lord of the vineyard said unto his steward, ‘Call the laborers and give them their hire, beginning from the last unto the first.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came that were hired about the eleventh hour, they received every man a penny.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the first came, they supposed they should have received more; and they likewise received every man a penny.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had received it, they murmured against the master of the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘These last have wrought but one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us who have borne the burden and the heat of the day.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered one of them and said, ‘Friend, I do thee no wrong. Didst thou not agree with me for a penny?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take that which is thine and go thy way. I will give unto this last, even as unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own? Is thine eye evil, because I am good?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the last shall be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few are chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, going up to Jerusalem, took the twelve disciples apart on the way and said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of Man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests and unto the scribes, and they shall condemn Him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall deliver Him to the Gentiles to mock and to scourge and to crucify Him. And the third day, He shall rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came to Him the mother of Zebedee’s children with her sons, worshiping Him and desiring a certain thing of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said unto her, “What wilt thou?” She said unto Him, “Grant that these my two sons may sit, the one on Thy right hand and the other on the left in Thy Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said, “Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?” They said unto Him, “We are able.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said unto them, “Ye shall drink indeed of My cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with; but to sit on My right hand and on My left is not Mine to give, but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared by My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ten heard it, they were moved with indignation against the two brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them unto Him and said, “Ye know that the princes of the Gentiles exercise dominion over them, and they that are great exercise authority upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it shall not be so among you; but whosoever will be great among you, let him be your minister;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whosoever will be chief among you, let him be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as the Son of Man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give His life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they departed from Jericho, a great multitude followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, two blind men were sitting by the wayside when they heard that Jesus was passing by, and they cried out, saying, “Have mercy on us, O Lord, Thou Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude rebuked them, that they should hold their peace; but they cried out the more, saying, “Have mercy on us, O Lord, Thou Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stood still, and called them and said, “What will ye that I shall do unto you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said unto Him, “Lord, that our eyes may be opened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus had compassion on them and touched their eyes, and immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem and had come to Bethphage unto the Mount of Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying unto them, “Go into the village opposite you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her. Loose them and bring them unto Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any man say aught unto you, ye shall say, ‘The Lord hath need of them,’ and straightway he will send them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell ye the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek and sitting upon an ass, and a colt, the foal of an ass.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples went and did as Jesus commanded them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought the ass and the colt and put on them their clothes, and they set Him thereon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way; and others cut down branches from the trees and strewed them in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried out, saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is He that cometh in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, “Who is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude said, “This is Jesus, the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all those who sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers and the seats of those who sold doves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called the house of prayer,’ but ye have made it a den of thieves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the blind and the lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that He did, and the children crying out in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they were sore displeased,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto Him, “Hearest thou what these say?” And Jesus said unto them, “Yea, have ye never read, ‘Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings Thou hast perfected praise’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He left them and went out of the city into Bethany, and He lodged there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the morning as He returned into the city, He hungered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He saw a fig tree by the wayside, He came to it and found nothing thereon, but leaves only. And He said unto it, “Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever.” And immediately the fig tree withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, “How soon has the fig tree withered away!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, “Verily I say unto you, if ye have faith and doubt not, ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, ‘Be thou removed and be thou cast into the sea,’ it shall be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all things whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto Him as He was teaching and said, “By what authority doest thou these things? And who gave thee this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, “I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell Me, I in like manner will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John: whence was it? From Heaven, or of men?” And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we shall say, ‘From Heaven,’ he will say unto us, ‘Why did ye not then believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we shall say, ‘Of men,’ we fear the people, for all hold John to be a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered Jesus and said, “We cannot tell.” And He said unto them, “Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But what think ye? A certain man had two sons. And he came to the first and said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, ‘I will not,’ but afterward he repented and went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to the second and said likewise. And he answered and said, ‘I go, sir,’ and went not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of those two did the will of his father?” They said unto Him, “The first.” Jesus said unto them, “Verily I say unto you, that the publicans and the harlots go into the Kingdom of God before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not; but the publicans and harlots believed him. And ye, when ye had seen it, repented not afterward, that ye might believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear another parable: There was a certain householder who planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and dug a wine press in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen and went into a far country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, that they might receive the fruits of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one and killed another and stoned another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, he sent other servants, more than the first; and they did unto them likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, ‘They will reverence my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they caught him and cast him out of the vineyard and slew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When therefore the lord of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said unto Him, “He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen, who shall render him the fruits in their seasons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, “Did ye never read in the Scriptures: ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner. This is the Lord’s doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say I unto you, the Kingdom of God shall be taken from you and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees had heard His parables, they perceived that He spoke of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they sought to lay hands on Him, they feared the multitude, because they took Him for a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and spoke unto them again in parables and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like unto a certain king, who made a marriage for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding, and they would not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent forth other servants, saying, ‘Tell them that are bidden, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready. Come unto the marriage.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they made light of it and went their ways, one to his farm, and another to his merchandise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the remnant took his servants and treated them spitefully and slew them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the king heard thereof he was wroth, and he sent forth his armies and destroyed those murderers and burned up their city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to his servants, ‘The wedding is ready, but they that were bidden were not worthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those servants went out into the highways, and gathered all together as many as they found, both bad and good, and the wedding was furnished with guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man who did not have on a wedding garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, ‘Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment?’ And he was speechless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the king to the servants, ‘Bind him hand and foot and take him away, and cast him into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many are called, but few are chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went and took counsel how they might entangle Him in His talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sent out unto Him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, “Master, we know that thou art true and teachest the way of God in truth; neither carest thou for any man, for thou regardest not the person of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell us therefore, what thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness and said, “Why tempt ye Me, ye hypocrites?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show Me the tribute money.” And they brought unto Him a penny.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said unto them, “Whose is this image and superscription?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto Him, “Caesar’s.” Then said He unto them, “Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar’s, and unto God the things that are God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had heard these words, they marveled, and left Him and went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same day the Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection, came to Him and asked Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Master, Moses said, ‘If a man die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up seed unto his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were with us seven brethren. And the first, when he had married a wife, died; and having no issue, he left his wife unto his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise the second also, and the third, unto the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And last of all, the woman died also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore in the resurrection, whose wife shall she be of the seven? For they all had her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, “Ye do err, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels of God in Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the multitude heard this, they were astonished at His doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees had heard that He had put the Sadducees to silence, they were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them, who was a lawyer, asked Him a question, tempting Him and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Master, which is the great commandment in the law?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “‘Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the first and great commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second is like unto it: ‘Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On these two commandments hang all the Law and the Prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “What think ye of Christ? Whose Son is He?” They said unto Him, “The son of David.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto them, “How then doth David in the Spirit call Him ‘Lord,’ saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The Lord said unto my Lord, “Sit Thou on My right hand until I make Thine enemies Thy footstool”’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If David then call Him ‘Lord,’ how is He his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no man was able to answer Him a word; neither dared any man from that day forth ask Him any more questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then spoke Jesus to the multitude and to His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe, that observe and do; but do ye not according to their works; for they say, and do not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and lay them on men’s shoulders, but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all their works they do to be seen by men. They make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge the borders of their garments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and love the uppermost places at feasts and the chief seats in the synagogues,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and greetings in the markets, and to be called by men, ‘Rabbi, Rabbi.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be not ye called ‘Rabbi,’ for One is your Master, even Christ; and all ye are brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And call no man your father upon earth, for One is your Father, who is in Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither be ye called masters, for One is your Master, even Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased, and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye shut up the Kingdom of Heaven against men, for ye neither go in yourselves, neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers; therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he is made, ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe unto you, ye blind guides, who say, ‘Whosoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye fools and blind! For which is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifieth the gold?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye say, ‘Whosoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it, he is liable.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye fools and blind! For which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifieth the gift?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar, sweareth by it and by all things thereon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoso shall swear by the temple, sweareth by it and by Him that dwelleth therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that shall swear by Heaven, sweareth by the throne of God and by Him that sitteth thereon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier matters of the law: judgment, mercy, and faith. These ought ye to have done and not to leave the other undone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye blind guides, who strain out a gnat and swallow a camel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and excess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou blind Pharisee, cleanse first that which is within the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye are like unto whited sepulchers, which indeed appear beautiful outwardly, but are within full of dead men’s bones and of all uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men, but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because ye build the tombs of the prophets and garnish the sepulchers of the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore ye are witnesses against yourselves, that ye are the children of them that killed the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fill ye up, then, the measure of your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ye serpents, ye generation of vipers! How can ye escape the damnation of hell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, behold, I send unto you prophets and wise men and scribes, and some of them ye shall kill and crucify, and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues and persecute them from city to city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zechariah, son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, all these things shall come upon this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, thou that killest the prophets and stonest them that are sent unto thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, and ye would not!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, ye shall not see Me henceforth till ye shall say, ‘Blessed is He that cometh in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went out and departed from the temple, and His disciples came to Him to show Him the buildings of the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, “See ye not all these things? Verily I say unto you, there shall not be left here one stone upon another that shall not be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as He sat upon the Mount of Olives, the disciples came unto Him privately, saying, “Tell us, when shall these things be? And what shall be the sign of Thy coming and of the end of the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, “Take heed that no man deceive you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for many shall come in My name, saying, ‘I am Christ,’ and shall deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that ye be not troubled, for all these things must come to pass, but the end is not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation shall rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and there shall be famines and pestilences and earthquakes in divers places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these are the beginning of sorrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted and shall kill you, and ye shall be hated by all nations for My name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then shall many lose faith and shall betray one another and shall hate one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many false prophets shall rise and shall deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because iniquity shall abound, the love of many shall wax cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this Gospel of the Kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations, and then shall the end come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (whoso readeth, let him understand),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let them that be in Judea flee unto the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him that is on the housetop not come down to take anything out of his house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither let him that is in the field return back to take his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time, no, nor ever shall be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unless those days should be shortened, there should no flesh be saved; but for the elect’s sake, those days shall be shortened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if any man shall say unto you, ‘Lo, here is Christ,’ or ‘there,’ believe it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there shall arise false christs and false prophets and shall show great signs and wonders, insomuch that, if it were possible, they shall deceive the very elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have told you before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if they shall say unto you, ‘Behold, He is in the desert!’ go not forth; or ‘Behold, He is in the secret chambers!’ believe it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the lightning cometh out of the east and shineth even unto the west, so shall also the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For wheresoever the carcass is, there will the eagles be gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then shall appear the sign of the Son of Man in heaven. And then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of Man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and with great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He shall send His angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together His elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn a parable of the fig tree: When his branch is yet tender and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is nigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise ye, when ye shall see all these things, know that it is near, even at the doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, this generation shall not pass till all these things be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but My Words shall not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But of that day and hour, knoweth no man, no, not the angels of Heaven, but My Father only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as the days of Noah were, so shall also the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ark
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and knew not until the flood came and took them all away, so shall also the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall two be in the field; the one shall be taken and the other left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women shall be grinding at the mill; the one shall be taken and the other left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Watch therefore, for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch the thief would come, he would have watched and would not have suffered his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be ye also ready, for in such an hour as ye think not, the Son of Man cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his lord hath made ruler over his household, to give them meat in due season?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord, when he cometh, shall find so doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, that he shall make him ruler over all his goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that evil servant shall say in his heart, ‘My lord delayeth his coming,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall begin to smite his fellow servants and to eat and drink with the drunken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him, and in an hour that he is not aware of,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall cut him asunder and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then shall the Kingdom of Heaven be likened unto ten virgins, who took their lamps and went forth to meet the bridegroom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And five of them were wise, and five were foolish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that were foolish took their lamps and took no oil with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at midnight there was a cry made: ‘Behold, the bridegroom cometh; go ye out to meet him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all those virgins arose and trimmed their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the foolish said unto the wise, ‘Give us of your oil, for our lamps are gone out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wise answered, saying, ‘Not so, lest there be not enough for us and you; but go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came, and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage, and the door was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward came also the other virgins, saying, ‘Lord, lord, open to us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, ‘Verily I say unto you, I know you not.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of Man cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Kingdom of Heaven is as a man traveling into a far country, who called his own servants and delivered unto them his goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, to every man according to his several ability, and straightway tookhis journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same, and made them another five talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And likewise he that had received two, he also gained another two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that had received one went and dug in the earth and hid his lord’s money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After a long time the lord of those servants came and reckoned with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so he that had received five talents came and brought the other five talents, saying, ‘Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents. Behold, I have gained beside them five talents more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His lord said unto him, ‘Well done, thou good and faithful servant. Thou hast been faithful over a few things; I will make thee ruler over many things. Enter thou into the joy of thy lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He also that had received two talents came and said, ‘Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents; behold, I have gained two other talents beside them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His lord said unto him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. Thou hast been faithful over a few things; I will make thee ruler over many things. Enter thou into the joy of thy lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he that had received the one talent came and said, ‘Lord, I knew thee, that thou art a hard man, reaping where thou hast not sown, and gathering where thou hast not strewed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth. Lo, there thou hast what is thine.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His lord answered and said unto him, ‘Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I have not strewed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou ought therefore to have placed my money with the exchangers, and then at my coming I should have received mine own with interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him that hath ten talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance; but from him that hath not, shall be taken away even that which he hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Son of Man shall come in His glory and all the holy angels with Him, then shall He sit upon the throne of His glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And before Him shall be gathered all nations, and He shall separate them one from another as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He shall set the sheep on His right hand, but the goats on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the King say unto them on His right hand, ‘Come, ye blessed of My Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I hungered, and ye gave Me meat; I was thirsty, and ye gave Me drink; I was a stranger, and ye took Me in;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: naked, and ye clothed Me; I was sick, and ye visited Me; I was in prison, and ye came unto Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the righteous answer Him, saying, ‘Lord, when saw we Thee hungering and fed Thee, or thirsty and gave Thee drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When saw we Thee a stranger and took Thee in, or naked and clothed Thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or when saw we Thee sick, or in prison, and came unto Thee?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King shall answer and say unto them, ‘Verily I say unto you, inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these My brethren, ye have done it unto Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then shall He say also unto them on the left hand, ‘Depart from Me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire prepared for the devil and his angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I hungered, and ye gave Me no meat; I was thirsty, and ye gave Me no drink;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a stranger, and ye took Me not in; naked, and ye clothed Me not; sick and in prison, and ye visited Me not.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall they also answer Him, saying, ‘Lord, when saw we Thee hungering or athirst or a stranger, or naked or sick or in prison, and did not minister unto Thee?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall He answer them, saying, ‘Verily I say unto you, inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did it not to Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these shall go away into everlasting punishment, but the righteous into life eternal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, He said unto His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ye know that after two days is the Feast of the Passover, and the Son of Man is betrayed to be crucified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests and the scribes and the elders of the people assembled together unto the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and consulted that they might take Jesus by stealth and kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: there came unto Him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment, and poured it on His head as He sat at meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when His disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, “To what purpose is this waste?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this ointment might have been sold for much and given to the poor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus perceived this, He said unto them, “Why trouble ye the woman? For she hath wrought a good work upon Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye have the poor always with you, but Me ye have not always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in that she hath poured this ointment on My body, she did it for My burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, wheresoever this Gospel shall be preached in the whole world, there shall also this, which this woman hath done, be told as a memorial of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto them, “What will ye give me if I will deliver Him unto you?” And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying unto Him, “Where wilt Thou that we prepare for Thee to eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Go into the city to a certain man and say unto him, ‘The Master saith, “My time is at hand; I will keep the Passover at thy house with My disciples.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them, and they made ready the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the evening had come, He sat down with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they ate, He said, “Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto Him, “Lord, is it I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered and said, “He that dippeth his hand with Me in the dish, the same shall betray Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man goeth as it is written of Him, but woe unto that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It had been good for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas, who betrayed Him, answered and said, “Master, is it I?” He said unto him, “Thou hast said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread and blessed it and broke it, and gave it to the disciples and said, “Take, eat; this is My body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took the cup and gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, “Drink ye all of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this is My blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you, I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new with you in My Father’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out unto the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, “All ye shall be offended because of Me this night; for it is written: ‘I will smite the Shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered and said unto Him, “Though all men shall be offended because of Thee, yet I will never be offended.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “Verily I say unto thee, that this night before the cock crow, thou shalt deny Me thrice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said unto Him, “Though I should die with Thee, yet will I not deny Thee.” Likewise also said all the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and said unto the disciples, “Sit ye here while I go and pray yonder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and very heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said unto them, “My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death; tarry ye here and watch with Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He went a little farther, and fell on His face and prayed, saying, “O My Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from Me; nevertheless, not as I will, but as Thou wilt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He came unto the disciples and found them asleep, and said unto Peter, “What, could ye not watch with Me one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away again the second time and prayed, saying, “O My Father, if this cup may not pass away from Me, unless I drink it, Thy will be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He came and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He left them and went away again, and prayed a third time, saying the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came He to His disciples and said unto them, “Sleep on now, and take your rest. Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rise, let us be going. Behold, he is at hand that doth betray Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while He yet spoke, lo, Judas, one of the twelve came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he that betrayed Him gave them a sign, saying, “Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is He; hold Him fast.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And forthwith he came to Jesus and said, “Hail, Master!” and kissed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, “Friend, why art thou come?” Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and took Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, one of those who was with Jesus stretched out his hand and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest and smote off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto him, “Put up again thy sword into his place, for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to My Father, and He shall at once give Me more than twelve legions of angels?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But how then shall the Scriptures be fulfilled, that thus it must be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same hour Jesus said to the multitudes, “Are ye come out as against a thief, with swords and staves to take Me? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple, and ye laid no hold on Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all this was done that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples forsook Him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who had laid hold on Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter followed Him afar off unto the high priest’s palace, and went in and sat with the servants to see the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests and elders and all the council sought false witness against Jesus to put Him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but found none. Yea, though many false witnesses came, yet found they none. At the last came two false witnesses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “This fellow said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to build it in three days.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high priest arose and said unto Him, “Answerest thou nothing? What is it which these witnesses say against thee?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus held His peace. And the high priest answered and said unto Him, “I adjure thee by the living God that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “Thou hast said; nevertheless I say unto you, hereafter shall ye see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, “He hath spoken blasphemy! What further need have we of witnesses? Behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What think ye?” They answered and said, “He is deserving of death!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spit in His face and buffeted Him, and others smote Him with the palms of their hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Prophesy unto us, thou Christ! Who is he that smote thee?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter sat outside in the palace, and a damsel came unto him, saying, “Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it before them all, saying, “I know not what thou sayest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had gone out onto the porch, another maid saw him and said unto those who were there, “This fellow was also with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he denied with an oath, “I do not know the man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after a while came unto him those who stood by, and said to Peter, “Surely thou also art one of them, for thy speech betrayeth thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to curse and to swear, saying, “I know not the man!” And immediately the cock crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, when He said unto him, “Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny Me thrice.” And he went out and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the morning had come, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put Him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had bound Him, they led Him away and delivered Him to Pontius Pilate, the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas, who had betrayed Him, when he saw that He was condemned, repented and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood.” And they said, “What is that to us? See thou to that!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple and departed, and went and hanged himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests took the silver pieces and said, “It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took counsel and bought with them the potter’s field, to bury strangers in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore that field was called the Field of Blood unto this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of Him that was valued, whom they the children of Israel did value,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord appointed me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked Him, saying, “Art thou the King of the Jews?” And Jesus said unto him, “Thou sayest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He was accused by the chief priests and elders, He answered nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Pilate unto Him, “Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered him never a word, insomuch that the governor marveled greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at that feast, the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner, whom they would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they had then a notable prisoner called Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, “Whom will ye that I release unto you: Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he knew that for envy they had delivered Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had sat down on the judgment seat, his wife sent unto him, saying, “Have thou nothing to do with that just man; for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask for Barabbas and destroy Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The governor answered and said unto them, “Which of the two will ye that I release unto you?” They said, “Barabbas!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said unto them, “What shall I do then with Jesus, who is called Christ?” They all said unto him, “Let him be crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the governor said, “Why, what evil hath he done?” But they cried out the more, saying, “Let him be crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate saw that he could not prevail, but rather that a tumult was beginning, he took water and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, “I am innocent of the blood of this just person. See ye to it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered all the people and said, “His blood be on us, and on our children!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then released he Barabbas unto them; and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered Him to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall, and gathered unto Him the whole detachment of soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stripped Him and put on Him a scarlet robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had plaited a crown of thorns, they put it upon His head and a reed in His right hand, and they bowed their knees before Him and mocked Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they spat upon Him, and took the reed and smote Him on the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had mocked Him, they took the robe off from Him and put His own raiment on Him, and led Him away to crucify Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name; him they compelled to bear His cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a Place of a Skull,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they gave Him vinegar to drink mingled with gall. And when He had tasted thereof, He would not drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they crucified Him and parted His garments, casting lots, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet: “They parted My garments among them, and upon My vesture did they cast lots.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sitting down, they watched Him there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and set up over His head His accusation, written: This Is Jesus The King Of The Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then were there two thieves crucified with Him, one on the right hand and another on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who passed by reviled Him, wagging their heads
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Thou that destroyest the temple and buildest it in three days, save thyself! If thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking Him, with the scribes and elders said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He saved others; himself he cannot save. If he be the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He trusted in God; let Him deliver him now, if He will have him. For he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thieves also, who were crucified with Him, cast the same in His teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.
